laboratory_examinations.findings: Abnormal liver function tests noted at age 5.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At age 18, laboratory values included: international normalized prothrombin ratio 1.96; hemoglobin 6.2 g/L; white-cell count 4040/mm3; platelets 33,000/mm3; bilirubin 32.7 mg/dL; aspartate aminotransferase 240 U/L; gamma-glutamyltransferase 30 U/L; alkaline phosphatase 114 U/L; creatinine 1.9 mg/dL; albumin 1.8 g/dL; alpha-fetoprotein 4.5 ng/mL.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Presence of sclerosing cholangitis noted at age 10.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Throat-Swab, Urine, Blood, and Stool Specimens for Cytomegalovirus and Cryptosporidium
laboratory_examinations.findings: Negative for cytomegalovirus; stool specimens checked for cryptosporidium.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Throat-swab and urine tests performed twice weekly.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Abnormal results prompted a liver biopsy demonstrating mild cholangiolitic changes.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Aspartate aminotransferase values returned to normal; gamma-glutamyltransferase remained elevated at 469 U/L, necessitating another liver biopsy three weeks later, revealing mild focal injury of the bile ducts.

laboratory_examinations.findings: In excellent health with: hemoglobin 12.3 g/L; white cell count 6500/mm3; neutrophils 2740/mm3; platelets 156,000/mm3; international normalized prothrombin ratio 1.0; bilirubin 0.6 mg/dL; aspartate aminotransferase 39 U/L; gamma-glutamyltransferase 52 U/L; albumin 3.5 g/dL.
No expression of CD40 ligand on T cells.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: By day 95, 35% of cells were positive for CD40 ligand expression.
